values:
Okay. So.

Last night, I produced a pretty huge post with two dozen illustrations, all neatly tucked behind a cut. But it seems livejournal doesn't particularly favor wide pictures, so at least a third of them were horrendously cut off. I just deleted the entry, no use keeping it like that. I did try today to make thumbnails for each image, though, and to struggle with the table and link system the livejournal editor provides. Hopefully this will work out.

I haven't drawn or written anything in years due to my previously mentioned bout of depression. I've started to again, though, and it's been therapeutic. Please don't judge these images harshly, none of them are meant to be professional... they're not meant to be anything. They were images from characters or scenes in stories and projects of mine that I doodled out simply for the joy of creating and to try and get down the images in my head onto something solid.

Anyway, I hope that you enjoy them as much as I enjoyed bringing them to life.

Edit: Cool! It worked. I am a happy Cara.

Edit II: I apologise for the terrible, pixelly quality. I don't have any of the former art or image editing programs I once did.

Hey bitches, I am totally back.

And my, my, my, has it been a long time.

I needed a (rather incredibly long) hiatus from writing my own personal feelings. A few years back, around when the last entry of this was posted, all I could bring myself to pen were horrible thoughts and feelings. Writing out my sadness didn't really make me feel any better about it, rather, it truly brought me down even further. I needed to get away from that for a while.

In case anyone around is still wondering about me, I did fall into a depression for a few years. It got pretty bad. I won't really venture into the gritty details here, but it wasn't pleasant for me and it wasn't pleasant for the people around me. Recently it became so bad that I started hurting myself and I entertained some very dark thoughts regarding removing myself from this world. 

Fortuantely, I never entertained them deeply enough to do anything stupid. After several very difficult events, I managed to find my way slowly back into the arms of my old friend happiness. For the first time in too many years, I felt inspired to be me again, inspired to create, inspired to love and enjoy my life. I hadn't drawn or written anything in what seemed silent centuries, and I simply had no will to approach doing so. But that is very different now, and I feel I'm well enough to return to writing in my old little space on the interwebs again. It's kind of nice really.

Anyway, if you're still out there, and reading this, hello to you. I haven't forgotten you, I just needed to go hide from the world for a while and recover from my own angry inner critic. I must admit that the person writing this entry is quite a bit of a different one than the girl who penned the last one. Time is a curious thing. It alters, soothes, molds one into something else. We are not stagnant creatures. I'm not an entirely different person, though. I'm still trying to write that old story I kept mentioning in here about the elves and crap, though thankfully it's not quite so juvenile anymore. I still hope to get it published. 

Anyhow, I must admit to aching a bit; today was a very long day. I'll post more later of course. Writing this, I realized how much I missed livejournal. I hope you are all doing marvelously, whatever path your life has taken you on.

Though I am not all too active on the internet anymore, I still play NWN a bit. (I asked for Guild Wars for Christmas, maybe I will get it.) My character I have been using consistently on roleplay servers is Yve Idorian, an Avariel (winged) elf.

Thought I would provide a couple of screen shots to show how freaking awesome looking she is. I'm going to write a story outside of NWN about her, and make the places/races original etc and non D&D.


She is holding a really weird looking spear there. I love her robes; I put a lot of time into crafting them. They're an important plot item from her past. They are enchanted. :D Yay.


Holding up a flaming short-sword. XD
I have many ideas for her that I want to use in story (or even comic?) form. It will be very neat.

The Messenger On a Tuesday afternoon, a man died. They carried his corpse inside and there it lay for Days. It did not rot. I sat in the room where he Lingered. Deafening silence--sometimes he opened his eyes And peered at me with milky pale blue: Speaking, or trying to speak. I cried. He would not decay and they would not take him Anywhere else. His haunting existence filled my Brain with terror and I wept for everything I was And all that he was not. Still, the quiet lingered. Flowers grew from the floor on which he lay. Black, wilted, twisting things of rue and enigma. I could not bring myself to tear at them, to pull the Roots from his skin. No one knew why I was crying.

I really miss myself.


I miss the people who used to love me.

I was browsing around the internet this morning (at school.) Specifically I was browsing around the official Wizards of the Coast (D&D) page. I happened across the job opportunities and the area about writers. WotC apparently publish independant fantasy fiction.

I got so excited I nearly fell out of my chair. I mean it. I'm not talking about one of those cute little "I FELL OUT OF MY CHAIR HAHA" things, I actually almost did. It was sad. Anyway, that is totally going to be my goal. I want to write some really, really cool fantasy novel(s) and try my hardest to get them published. By Wizards of the Coast.

Wouldn't that be hot?

They posed a challenge to me on the website, and I want to meet it. They say they are looking for original ideas that capture them as readers. I want to do it. I can do it. I will.

I made Catface via the Hero Machine.

Make your own atrocity now!

There is a big thing going on among the intarweb artist community called Art for Katrina.

If you would love to have a wonderful, talented artist draw a request of your heart's content for an amazingly cheap price and if you would like to help out charities such as the Red Cross and Mercy Corps, here's your chance, kiddo.

In the short time I've been there, several new artists have joined and the list is only growing. I will be very surprised if you cannot find at least one style or specialty that does not fit what you may be looking for in an art commission.

Anyway, check it out, and please, spread the link so we can reach more artists/people in need of an artist.

Art For Katrina

Today I am the champion.

[Edit: My tongue hurts.]

HELLO I AM A CATFACE



Also:

REMEMBER THIS ALWAYS

Today has been so excellent to me. I'm in a great mood.

I actually got 8 hours of sleep for the first time in two weeks, and I even had a really cool nightmare. XD; Most nightmares aren't cool but this one was more like some kind of night terror and I woke up having severe neck spasms that I didn't quite know I could have. :D

I brought Pink Floyd's "A Momentary Lapse of Reason" CD and Ike played it in the car very loudly. It was a great way to start a morning. When we arrived at school, I purchased a breakfast of potato cakes, french toast, and vitamin D enriched milk. I am so posh. It was totally delicious though.

Whoo. To top it all, I don't have work today. Really, that makes all the difference in the world. I went to bed and woke up feeling so much better than I have been. I feel I have an eternity to do things (after I get home from school today.) I have nine hours to spend doing whatever I choose. It's so wonderful.

Speaking of which, my parents talked to me about quitting my job. I want to. I've been wanting to. It's not that I don't like Udder's (even now I feel a pang of guilt at the thought of leaving, as the place has been good to me for nearly a year) but I'm not quite faring well with the full-time-school schedule thing + six hour a day work. :D Really, I think I'm not being fair to Udder's by staying. I'm not the worker I used to be.

I have always prided myself in doing a nice job and I have gone out of my way before to ensure things are done and are satisfactorily clean. But as of late, I find myself so tired and exhausted by the time I even arrive to work that I have not been even completing expected/basic tasks to satisfaction. It's really not fair of me at all, but I've been so tired.

Seriously, though, the thought of having time to focus on school/other projects during the day is so awesome to me that I am in a great mood now. I think really all I need to do is cancel my cell phone (which costs $200 to do, ick--yes, I screwed myself with that one :P) and I will be set.

Hooray. :(

[Edit: How about those $6.00 gas prices? XD Not here, but around the Atlanta area. It was covered on the morning news.]

I switched my LJ back to an old style that I'd made and missed a lot. I feel better now. No more default journal crap. My art has been incorperated into the theme and now I feel it is truly a piece of my own space (or something) and I actually feel inspired to make real entries in this journal, something I haven't done for months. I guess I just have to personalize things. :P

That took only a moment because I found I'd had all the layout settings saved. Seriously, fools, check it out sometime. Crazy kids.

Also I will for real get on AIM. I think I have Thursday off. Anyhoo, I have to get going because Ike is coming to pick me up (I carpool) early this morning for school, and I'm already falling asleep at the keyboard and talking gibberish. So. [Edit: SO HOW ABOUT THOSE $3.50 GAS PRICES, HUH, GUYS? HOW ABOUT IT?]


Also I've become a bit obsessed with Brokeback Mountain for real. Like, retarded obsessed. Contrary to the childish previous post about it, I'm really looking forward to seeing the movie because the storyline is going to be excellent (if they haven't changed too much, which I suspect they shouldn't be doing.) I really am in love with the short story it is based from and I think I will read it again if I get a chance. Mmm. So sad and lovely and beautiful. I love stuff like that.

I think in the future I will buy nine posters of the movie and put them all over my walls (probably overlapping) and I will buy the movie three times (twice on DVD and once on video) and... if they have t-shirts and action figures then by god I will buy them too. /end fangirl love

OHMYFUCKINGGOD

I JUST SAW THE GAY COWBOY MOVIE TRAILER

AND IT IS THE MAGIC

AND I WILL SEE IT

OH YES. OH YES.

I am really sorry that I have not been online/not been reading or replying to LJ (and LJ comments) but I am only home two hours a day because of school. I leave at about 7:00 AM and get home at 1:00 and leave for work at 3:00 and get home at 10:00 and go straight to sleep.

So yeah. I will get on that. :< Hopefully I will have internet time soon.

Hey Warcraft nerds,

I got really bored and so I just spent like three hours making the closest thing I could get to resemble a night elf in Neverwinter Nights. It was really hard because none of the armor looked anything like Night Elf attire, and the closest skin/hair tones I could get to accuracy are a pasty blue-grey skin and nearly midnight blue hair-tone. :P Hooray. But anyway. I am totally a dork.



I did all of this with the Community Expansion Pack (CEP) which is a downloadable extra feature of the game that allows one to add more features/further customize character appearance.





Basic picture/pose. I tried to get a good shot of the full body to show all the armor. I even looked a bit at a Blizzard reference for armor design, and made sure to keep small details in like the fact that she has no shoes, etc. I realize the tattoos on her chest are kind of exaggerated/weird (as well as a bit dark) but they were the only ones I could really get and if I would have made the tattoos any fainter, the color of her lips would have went faint and looked non-existant too. For some reason the program registers lip color and tattoo color as the same thing. It is also unfortunate that I could not get white eyes or any kind of facial markings.



I went so far as to make a longbow to accompany the outfit for, well, authenticity I guess. It wouldn't be right to see her running around with a scythe or something. :P Once again, I customized the bow and tried to give it a natural, woodsy kind of look. Or something. Yeah. Also, I christened the bow "LOLBow."



In the realization that there are just as many Night Elf druids as there are rangers/archers, I made "Ye Sticke" (another attempt at a natural/woodsy effect) which I tried to make resemble a druid's staff. Er, as for the odd pose, she had just fallen down and was standing back up when I took the screen shot. Hooray.

So yes, there is my dorky and retarded adventure but for some reason I feel both amused and accomplished. Hooray for elves.

Also I blame getting only five hours of sleep last night. Speaking of which...

Work in progress, I guess. *Hate stuff* ._.

Being home seems foreign and nothing is how I remember it. Yeah.

I am so tired of [my] art.

It is really not worth it.
England, my heart is with you today.

I cried when I got my paycheck.

It was $150 and I owe $140, plus two $60 bills.


I have no phone. It's been shut off. The cable's been shut off.

My car died for good, it's gone.

I'm driving a truck with no brakes. It takes $70 to fill the tank. The truck uses approximately twice as much gasoline as my car did.


I am filled with hatred and disgust with myself.

I don't want to Be Here anymore.

HAY EVERYBODY I AM REALLY EXCITED, YOU HAVE TO SEE THIS

If you are at Northwoods mall any time soon, stop by Udder's and sample the new ice cream flavor that I made. That's right, kids, I invented a flavor and Khalid actually made it! :D

It is called Double Chocolate Fudge with Almond. :'D At least that is what I said he should call it, if it is called somethin' else then bwah. But it is chocolate ice cream with syrupy/fudgy stuff swirled in and with sprinkles of almonds. YOU KNOW IT IS GOOOOOOD.

I am really proud, so go get some you ice cream eating fools.

1.) I'm really sorry. 2.) Thank you so much.

I feel like raging hell today. Also I could not sleep all night.

It is nothing too special, though. Slightly shabby and only $15 but still fun. I love it. I still want to purchase the crystal/silver liscensed version someday, though.

Nukid (Brian) at work is pretty cool, yeah. IT HAS BEEN DECIDED.

Ok, I am really really sorry that I keep going on about ebay, but this just really pisses me off. Hell, this isn't just about ebay, it is about art in general.

I have been browsing original painting sales on said website and I am getting really pissed off that these fucktards have no idea in hell how to price art.

Most of these paintings are absolutely gorgeous, and the artist obviously spent a lot of time on them, and if not time, then at least put a lot of creativity and a part of themselves into the paintings. However, I am seeing them selling these on the 'net for like $15.00 for an original, detailed oil painting.

NO?!

I wish that people would sit back and realize what they create is, in many ways, priceless, and should be at least worth more than a dozen dollars. : \ I'd say at the very least to charge $40 or $50 (at the LEAST) for a simple painting and $15.00 for a drawing or sketch.

Maybe I am just too expensive, I dunno. But it makes me really shocked and sad to see a lot of art go for obscene prices.

Artists: Do you have any opinions on this? Am I being too pricey, or do you feel art is often undervalued, etc? I'd really love to know what other artists felt about this.


Edit: I am actually thinking that even $50.00 is way too little for some of these paintings. Urgh.

Since I need money I am seriously thinking about making some paintings and selling them on ebay. Mostly like, stereotypical stuff that sells like hotcakes, like sad fairies blowing glitter around under the moonlight etc. Also, that subject is too tacky for me to become really attached to, cuz I have a problem often with parting with art that means something to me.

I just hope it will sell well. That would be sweet if it did, though, because some Stereotypical Fairy watercolor paintings were getting like anywhere from $20 - $200. Hooray!

I want to spend the rest of my life buying gorgeous necklaces off of ebay.

That's all. :3

Edit: I think maybe I will treat myself once every few weeks to a $5.00 item from ebay or something. I mean, that is not really a lot of money and there is a surprising number of really NICE things for $5.00 on there o_O.

Gonna look into getting a Paypal account.

Edit #2: Also before it is my intention to gain possession of:
- 1. Fox liscensed J. Peterman Heart of the Ocean (Titanic) replica, - 2. New Line Cinema liscensed Evenstar (LOTR) replica, - 3. New Line Cinema liscenced Nenya (LOTR) replica
before I die. Hopefully ebay will help me to achieve these dreams at a future point in time (as they are all rare/pricey. XD)

Edit #3, Damnit: Ok, I just found a PSP for $20.00 on there. (No shitting.) It claims to be in great condition and with all the parts. Really, though, I'm just scared to even think about that auction because in reality that PSP must be like seventy years old (somehow,) rotting from the inside out, and infested with a family of mice.

HAY GUYS

I need quick money for crack so I can make my way to the sunny land of Florida for three weeks this summer. So that means I am going to have a garage sale, and it is going to be the best garage sale of all time. I am not sure when I am going to have this garage sale, since I have been working a lot lately, but perhaps I shall ask for 2 - 3 days off next week.

HEY, WHO WANTS TO COME?

Yes, I know that I said I was making a new journal for my art, and I did. But this one just doesn't seem the same without a little bit of Cara artitude, so I think every once in a while I will still post a little something. Not nearly as much as I post in the art-specific journal, but highlights or special things, yeah.

I'm sorry, but art is just a part of me and will always have a place in my thoughts, and this journal is a collection of said thoughts.

This is actually a really strange product of mere boredom; I wanted to see what one of my characters would look like as a female (uh oh, TG) so here (s)he is. XD Yay.


Lots of stuff has been going on lately. Agh, I can't even remember a good portion of it from the top of my head, but yeah. ...I know I have some serious medical problems, though. Even my dad told me I need to see the doctor soon and my parents are strictly anti-doctor whenever possible. I've been getting the nastiest migraines I've ever had, ones that carry me to levels of pain that I didn't know existed. The other night I was screaming from the pain and though I was restricted to thriving in a pitch-dark room, the whole area emitted some blinding white light. This is the brightest black I've ever seen, I thought.

Also, I have been thirsty as hell (like, to obnoxious extremes, having to walk across the grocery store a total of six times (and this is holding myself back) during a 1.5 hour period to get some water from the fountain. All I can think about is getting something to drink. I don't care what it is. My mouth and throat are constantly dry and thirst has overtaken my thoughts to obsessive levels, much like someone who hasn't eaten in days begins to think or dream of food.

Ah, and lots of pissing, too (as a consequence.) :P I think I'm diabetic, actually. It does run in my family. Urgh. The migraines are the worst though. Well. That and the thirst. I'm almost intollerably thirsty right now. I just drank a shake, a glass of water, and two diet mountain dews. :(

Uh. Also I am going to Florida at the end of the summer which is really fucking awesome. I've never gone anywhere on a vacation. I have to work really hard to save up. Probably need to ask for more hours, etc. I am going with Ike to visit Heather who has moved back home (FL) temporarily for the summer. We are all coming back to IL together to resume fall classes at ICC. Yay.

Happy times. ALSO I GOT A GAMEBOY SP. It is sleek. I feel like a pimping bastard now. Oh yes, oh yes. You want to touch my SP.


Also I have a new LJ icon. Heh heh heh heh heh.

Unfortunately I don't know who to credit because I randomly found it.

godalmightyiwantguildwars

But no. I will save my money, like I promised myself I would do.

Hahaha, sorry for the more or less double-post but I want to describe the doll since I don't have a camera.

Taking the paint off the face is the hardest part. It clumps and smears and stains the actual vinyl head. The process of entirely removing facial paint takes about an hour.

Then, I carefully painted all of the facial features with a tiny, tiny brush. I used simple 98 cent craft paints. I gave her a completely new look (defined by a new set of eyes and a wicked red smile) and I painstakingly painted her fingernails black. It was very tricky because my hands were shaky.

Then I tied up her hair so that it is in an unusual and unique style, I tied it with a black ribbon I bought. I also had purchased a "Barbie fashion" shirt that was a purple medieval type top and I tied black ribbon around her sleeves and waist. I took an old skirt that is too small for me and cut out a lot of the (black) material from it and formed a skirt for her, one that is far too long for her so it is flowy and also it gives the illusion that she has creepily long legs. Finally, upon the doll stand, I put her in a pose that seemed to fit her expression best. I love it.

The whole process took about four and a half hours. :3 Well worth it, though. I just wish I had a camera. ._. Maybe I can post a sketch. ...That wouldn't quite be the same though.

Holy Jesus, guys

I wish so bad that I had a camera right now. I have an awesome new hobby.

Inspired by some webpages I found last night, I have begun to remake dolls. As in... taking a Barbie doll, scrubbing its face down with nail polish remover, repainting all the features in my own style, creating my own clothing for the doll, and restyling the hair.

Seriously, it is awesome. The finished product looks NOTHING like the original doll. They aren't pretty litlte big-eyed cartoony Barbies anymore. I am so fucking proud of myself, seriously, the second one I ever made is excellent and is this awesome cool gothic-type creepy lady with a strange smile on her face and medievalish clothes. It's SO COOL. Seriously, I love this. So much fun.
